Vastina needs the loan to pay workers who are harvesting maize and mulching her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are harvesting maize and mulching her banana plantation..

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  JIGUISEME  sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NIENA,  dans la région de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés
LALA, deuxième à partir de la droite,  fait la vente de condiment dans ce groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 carton de cube magi,  20 litres d’huile de palme, 5 paniers de d’oignon, 10 boite de concentrée de tomate au marché de Niena ville. 
 Elle effectue ses vente au marché de Fincolosoba à une clientèle composée principalement de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the Jiguiseme group are married women with an average age of 34 and, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of Niena, in the region of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is the group´s 10th loan request, made by the members in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs. They have fully repaid their previous loans.

Lala, second from the right in the picture, sells condiments. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 10 boxes of "Maggi" stock cubes, 20 litres of palm oil, 5 baskets of onions and 10 boxes of concentrated tomato paste from the market in Niena. She resells her merchandise at the market of Fincolosob to a clientèle composed mainly of women, for cash. She envisages earning an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which she will use to repay the loan and interest, some of which will be saved. She aims to increase her sales revenues so that she is better able to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment like amplifiers and speakers for the mobile disco sound.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants to borrow a loan to purchase cooking oil, sugar and cosmetics for resale. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 42 and takes care of his  children and wife. Inadequate capital, high fuel and transportation costs are his business challenges. He desires to educate his children and diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth used the previous loan to pay school fees for her child. However, she faces a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather. She maintains her dream of educating her children and buying land to grow more crops. Elizabeth needs the loan to pay workers who are tilling her garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are tilling her garden.

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chourn, age 55, operates a fish-selling business from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Most of her fish are caught from the river by her husband. However, she has to buy more fish in bulk from her frequent suppliers or other local fishermen as well. 

Mrs. Chourn has seven children. Three among them are already married, while the other four live together with their mother in the same house. 

Since her husband's fishing materials were ruined, the income from her business has also decreased. To sustain this revenue, Mrs. Chourn decided to pursue funds from HKL to purchase new fishing materials, including a boat. 

This loan will upgrade Mrs. Chourn's standard of living. She hopes to gain a greater quality of life as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing materials, including a boat.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie would like to borrow PHP 24,000 to fund her tailoring business. The tailoring business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Margie and her family with income that is improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business. She raises livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

Regina has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Azima

texts.fr:
Azima est une femme  âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire.  Elle a 03enfants dont 01 scolarisé. L’ainé a 22ans et le dernier 02ans.
Azima travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois, de bois de chauffe et du maïs depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à la maison à ses clients et n' éprouve aucune difficulté. Azima a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Azima voudrait faire prospérer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Azima is 35 years old and married to a serviceman. She has 3 children aged between 2 and 22, one of whom goes to school. Azima has been selling charcoal, firewood and corn since 2002. She sells the goods to her clients from her home unassisted, and experiences no difficulties.

Azima has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her business and, in the coming years, would like to make her business prosper. She plans to use the profits to help her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 31 years old. He sells toilet papers and belts to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy toilet papers and belts to sell.

loans.use: To buy toilet papers and belts to sell

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 33 years old and is married with two children. She sells used sweaters, bags, and shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 7 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy used sweaters, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters, bags, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Teresita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 35 years now, and she also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita would like to borrow PHP 15,000 to fund her sari-sari (general store) business. The business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Moses Mungai

texts.en:
Moses is a very happy man, because his business is doing well. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.

Moses has been selling clothes for the past three years, and he has applied for a fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more new clothes to add on the stock for sale so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

He hopes to expand his transport business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to add on the stock for sale so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou  âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de famille est un transporteur de calèche de profession depuis 18 ans. Et c’est avec les recettes de son activité qu’il arrive à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.  Il vend parallèlement des chevaux  et c’est d’ailleurs ce projet qui motive sa demande de prêt de cinq cent mille francs (500000fcfa) au niveau du guichet. Il faut noter  qu’il est à sa troisième expérience dans le crédit et qu’il a su tirer profil de ses opérations financières.
Amadou aimerai dans l’avenir  construire un abri pour ces bêtes  afin de faciliter l’accès  et les transactions.
texts.en:
Amadou is 39 years old, married and a father. He has been a calèche (horse-drawn carriage) driver for 18 years. The income from his business enables him to satisfy his family´s needs. He also has a sideline business selling horses, and it is for this enterprise that he is requesting a five hundred thousand franc (500 000 FCFA) loan from the UIMCEC branch.

Amadou is currently on his 3rd loan and has been able to make a profit from his financial activities. He would eventually like to be able to build a shelter for the animals, in order to facilitate access and business transactions.

loans.use: to buy horses for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old. She is from Nakuru. She is married to Christopher, and they have three children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old.

Judith has a food canteen that she has been running for the past four years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy cooking fat, rice, sugar, and other ingredients to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a big hotel [restaurant] in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 33-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married with four children, and the family has one additional orphaned child under their care.

Judith operates a fish-selling business, she has been in this business for the last 13 years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy fish stocks to sell. She will use profits to educate her children. Her dream is to buy land and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. She is married to Barack, and blessed with three  children aged between seven to 16 years.

For the last 13 years, Janet has operated a grocery stall, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy tomatoes, onions, fruits, and other foodstuffs. Her profits will be used to expand her business.

Her dream is to have a big business where she can supply commodities wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a 42-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to Isaac, and they have four children between the ages of 12 and 21 years.

For the last 10 years, Maureen has operated a fish-selling business in Kisumu. She is taking her first loan, which she will use to buy fresh fish to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to have a big fish-selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a thirty eight-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four children. She rears pigs in Kiambu. Beatrice has been in the business for six years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings.

This will be Beatrice’s second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more piglets and buy fertilizer for her tea farm. 

With the profit that she will get, she wants to use it to buy more piglets for rearing. In the future, she wants to expand on her farming to rear dairy cows to increase more income.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old. She is married to John, a farmer. Together they have five school-going children. Beatrice is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years. She gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 from her business.

This is her second term loan. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. The previous loan helped her expand her business through purchasing another piece of farming land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 44 years old and is married to Mary. Together they have one child, aged 14 years old. Patrick sells cereals and has been in this business for the past six years. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000 from his business.

This is Patrick's first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase stocks of beans, maize, and green grams for his business. He was brought to KADET LTD by another KADET client. He hopes to expand his business by selling cereals at wholesale to retailers.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as beans, maize, and green grams.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 56 years old and married. She has owned and operated a food stall in Bamburi, Mombasa, for the past ten years. 

This marks Sophia's second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to purchase foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. Sophia will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year-old businessman, married to Lucy who is a farmer. They are blessed with five children. He has been a blacksmith for the past 18 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy scrap metals for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a shop and sell his products.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metals

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married and has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and works hard to support her family. 

Francisca is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as soap and shampoo to sell in her store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, shampoo, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a widow aged 50 years old. She is blessed with five children aged 25, 23, 21, 20,and 16 years old. She operates a boutique in the Cheptongei area and has been running the business for 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed  her fifth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more clothing for the business. 


The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 50 years old,  a business lady, married to Daniel, a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 21, 18, 16 and nine years respectively. She has been a tailor for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 7,800 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Daniel will use the loan to buy cloth materials. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 34 years old single lady from Kisumu City. She has a child, aged 17 years.

She operates a second hand clothes selling business, and she has been in this business for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy ladies’ skirts, tops, and full dresses. 

She will use her profits to repay the loan. Her dream is to become a leading second-hand clothes supplier.

loans.use: to buy ladies' tops, skirts, and full dresses.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been operating a retail shop and mpesa shop for the last 13 years in Kangemi. She is 39 years old and married to Stanley. They have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, who is also a KADET client. She paid off her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to add float to her mpesa business and buy stock of rice, sugar, sweets for the retail shop.

In the future, Martha hopes to open another mpesa shop.

loans.use: to add float to her mpesa business, and buy stock of rice, sugar, sweets for the retail shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. She operates a salon in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last four years. She earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the organization's credit officers, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 21,000. She intends to use the loan to add stock of hair weaves, wigs and hair dyes needed for her saloon business.

She will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her children. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her salon. She also intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to add stock of hair weaves, wigs and hair dyes needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil, maize flour and washing detergents.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 64 years old and married to Pauline. They are blessed with four children.

Benson sells cows and bulls in the area of Kakuyuni Tala. He has been in this business for the last twelve years and earns an income of KES 18,000 per month.

Benson is applying for his first KADET LTD loan of KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase cows for resale. He will use the extra profit to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to own a slaughter house.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is 32 years old,  married, and has one child who is nine months old.  He operates a retail business where he provides washing services. He has been involved in this business for seven months.  Katana's business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He is also a driver, which increases his income. 

Katana is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase another washing machine.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of water. His business goal is to run a garage with a car wash within five years. He describes himself as honest and obedient.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Tata

texts.fr:
Madame Tata est âgée de 65 ans, veuve et mère 7 enfants. Elle  vit chez son feu  mari avec ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle  au  quartier Somono, de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle fréquenta l’école coranique et l’abandonna très tôt pour aider sa mère dans ses activités commerciales. Elle resta plusieurs années à coté de cette dernière jusqu'à son mariage. Elle bénéficiera d’une bonne éducation commerciale qui lui permettra de mieux se débrouiller dans le petit commerce.
Elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus avant  d’opter pour  l’achat vente d’habits. Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis 9 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est la qualité de ses habits haut de gamme.
Dans le but  de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à  ce prêt, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 54 mois, après avoir fait 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels  bien remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 1  balle  de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à la COMATEX de  Ségou.
Madame Tata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes .Elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 80 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (habillement, savons et médicaments). 
Son ambition est  de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Tata is 65 years old, widowed and the mother of 7 children. She lives in a traditional family setting with her children in her late husband´s place, in the Somono district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Tata was unable to attend school because of social reasons; she briefly attended Koranic school before leaving at a very early age to help her mother with her business activities. She worked by her mother´s side for several years before getting married, and benefited from a good commercial education which would enable her to get along better in the world of small retail. Tata tried out several revenue-generating activities before settling on the buying and resale of clothing. She has been selling clothes for 9 years and enjoys a good reputation and a large clientèle. Her high sales figures are due to the quality of her high end clothing.

Tata is requesting this loan in order to be able to meet her customer demand. She has been a member of Soro Yiriwaso for 54 months and is on her 4th individual loan, having already fully repaid 4 group loans and 3 individual ones. She plans to use this loan to buy a bale of pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric). She gets her supplies locally from the Compagnie Malienne des Textiles (COMATEX) in Ségou and sells her merchandise for cash or credit to a clientèle composed of men and women. She anticipates earning a monthly profit of 80 000 FCFA, which will allow her to cover some of her expenses (clothing, soap and medicine). Her aim is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old.  He is an enterprising businessman and he is married to Ann, a business lady.  They are blessed with one child who is seven years old. John has been running an agrovet shop whereby he sells animal medicines, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  John will use the loan to buy plant chemicals to sell in his shop. 

With the anticipated profit generated by this loan, he will educate his child.  His dream is to open a wholesale agrovet shop.

loans.use: to buy plant chemicals to sell in his shop

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon paid his previous loans well and is applying for his third loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to pay school fees for his child. 

With the anticipated profit from the farming business, he will buy another piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 30 years old. She is married with three children: Lucy, Benson and Purity. She is a business lady who sells clothes in Nakuru. She has been in the business for the past two years. She makes a monthly income of 15,860 Kenyan shillings.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is already registered with KADET. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD . 


She will use the loan to purchase clothes for resale in her business and will save the anticipated profit for future investments. Her dream is to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 50 years old, married  and blessed with five children aged 26, 24, 18, 15 and 11 years old.  He owns a butcher shop and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He is servicing a first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase livestock for slaughter to add more stock of meat in his butcher shop. The profits will be used to educate his school-going children and pay back the loan.

He hopes to prosper in business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El Sr Felipe es de la ciudad de Mariano, tiene 49 años y su profesion es Constructor. Tiene 2 hijas, una de ellas estudiante Universitaria y la otra está cursando la secundaria. Anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa y ahora ya está trabajando independientemente y le va muy bien.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que gracias al buen trabajo que siempre hace siempre tiene propuestas de trabajo, y que gracias a Dios nunca le falta. Su meta siempre ha sido querer dar a su familia todo, para que no pasen por ningun tipo de privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de tejas y cemento, pues quiere invertirlo en su casa, ya que desea ir creciendo y mejorando cada día. Agradece a kiva y a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo que le da.
texts.en:
Felipe, age 49, is from the city of Mariano.  He is a builder, and he has two daughters.  One of them attends the university, and the other is in high school.  He previously worked for a company, and now he is working independently.  It is going very well for him.

He is a very hard-working and enterprising person.  He tells us that thanks to the good work he always does, he always has work proposals.  Thanks to God that he is never in need.  His goal has always been wanting to give his family everything.  He wants to do this so they do not experience any type of deprivation.

He is requesting the loan to buy cement and shingles, which he wants to use on his house.  He wishes to continue growing and improving every day.  He is grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for the support they give him.

loans.use: to buy shingles and cement.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and is married to Ann. They are blessed with two children.

Charles operates a motorcycle transport service to the residents of Kingstone, Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last one and half years and gets an income of 9,000 KES per month. He is applying for his first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use the loan to buy new spare parts for the motorbike.

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and expand his business. Charles hopes to  grow his business and buy a car to offer taxi services and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for the motorbike.

loans.name: Chemutai

texts.en:
Sheila is 38 years old, married to Stephen, and blessed with two children, ages 15 and five years, respectively. She owns a motorcycle repair shop which she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 32,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 to purchase cycle and motorbike spare parts. 

The profit from her business will boost her personal account. Her dream is to see her business expand. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married lady aged 47 years old and blessed with seven children aged between 25 years and eight years old. Her spouse is a farmer thus adding monthly income to the family. Esther owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She is servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase one bag of sugar (50 kg), two cartons of washing bar soaps, and one bale of wheat flour. The profits will be used to plough back into the business and for the family upkeep.

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate her children to higher levels

loans.use: To purchase one bag of sugar (50 kg), two cartons of washing bar soaps,and one bale of wheat flour.

loans.name: Bernard Mweremi

texts.en: Bernard paid his previous loans successfully; his business is doing great, and he earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. He is requesting a loan of 85,000 KES to purchase a new motorbike and add more spare parts for sale. Profit from his business will help him repay his loan and buy a plot of land. He hopes to own a wholesale shop for motor bikes and spare parts. This is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a  new motorbike and spare parts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old.  She is the mother of seven children, three of whom are adults.  She has been in farming for 30 years and her maize and beans are sold locally. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says the venture will provide the family with milk for daily consumption and income to educate the four children still attending school.

She laments the poor road conditions, leading to high transportation and raw materials costs.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 25 years old.  He is married and has two children, both under the age of four years.  He has had five years of farming experience in his rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and currently produces milk and tea for the local market.  He also subsidizes his farming income with a bicycle transportation business known locally as "boda boda."

Alfred has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter (a machine that cuts corn husks or stovers into smaller pieces) and a modern dairy unit for his growing number of cows.  He says the chuff cutter will ease the feeding of the dairy cows as well as reduce waste on feed that is hard to come buy.  He adds the modern dairy unit will provide shelter for his growing number of cows.  Alfred indicates lack of capital is the major business challenge he faces.  Through his farming activities, Alfred is able to meet all his family obligations.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter and construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is aged 37 and is a farmer in the Kitale area, where he lives with his family of four children aged between 13 and 11 years. He has been making his supplies of maize, beans and sweet potatoes available to the local market for the past 10 years besides his retail shop business.

Ronald has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into the poultry farming business. He says it's easier to run a poultry business due to its flexibility for small land use, unlike other farming businesses like maize and beans, which need expansive parcels of land for greater production.

Ronald sees lack of capital and animal diseases as the major challenges in his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 29 years old, and he operates a motorcycle transport business, locally known as a boda boda. He started this business three years ago. His monthly income is 6,000 KES. 

Geofrey requests a loan of 20,000 KES to service his motor bike. The anticipated profit from his business would aid him in repaying this loan. This is Geofrery's first loan, and he hopes it will ensure the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 27 years old, single, with no dependents. He is a carpenter. He started his carpentry business a year ago and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Rogers has applied for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy timber, velvet, and other materials, like glue and nails. 

The anticipated profit from this loan would help him exploit other business opportunities. His dreams are to expand his business and create employment opportunities for family, friends, and local young people.

loans.use: to buy timber, velvet, and materials like glue and nails.

loans.name: Marcellina

texts.en:
Marcellina is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling medical drugs in Kator, South Sudan for six years.
Marcellina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase gloves and medical drugs. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase gloves and medical drugs for sale.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 45 years old and has two children, aged 25 and 20 years respectively. She sells cabbages and carrots on a wholesale basis. She started the business 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cabbages and carrots. Profit from her business will help her repay her loan and fulfill her needs. Her dream is to improve her living standards and be happy. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages and carrots.

loans.name: Am- Dalatou

texts.fr:
Am-Dalatou est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un  électricien bâtiment. Elle a 02 enfants tous  à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 06ans.  
Am-Dalatou travaille comme revendeuse de bonneteries et de produits de beauté depuis 2003. Elle vend seule de façon ambulante à ses nombreux clients.
Am-Dalatou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de bonneteries et des produits de beauté. Elle veut louer une boutique avec les profits supplémentaires. 
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Am-Dalatou is 31 years old and married to a building electrician. She has 2 children who both attend school. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 6.

Am-Dalatou has been selling hosiery and beauty products since 2003. She is a street vendor and works alone selling to her numerous customers on the street. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on hosiery and beauty products. She plans to use the profits from her business to improve her family's living conditions. She would like to use any extra profits to rent a shop.

loans.use: to buy hosiery and beauty products.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 37 year-old businesswoman, who lives in Juba Nimule.  She is married and has seven children between the ages of three and 16 years old.  Five of her children attend school. 

Mohamed runs a small bar business.  She has been in business for four years and she has one employee.  Mohamed heard about Finance South Sudan from fellow clients as well as outreach and promotion done by the loan officers.  She is requesting a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase more drinks like beer and sodas.  In additions to this business, Mohamed earns income by collecting rent. Her major challenges include home expenses and lack of transport because some times she gets items like soda from the neighboring country. 

In five years time, Mohamed hopes to run a bigger bar and have a better house to rent to improve the family’s finances and living conditions. 

Mohamed says that she appreciates Finance South Sudan’s support, which leads to the growth of her business and should continue.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, including beer and sodas.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Aisha has a business selling green bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas. She also generates additional income through a retail shop.

The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease on transportation and also to become a wholesaler. Aisha lives in a home that she owns; she has have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for six years. A new member of HSPFI, Clarita is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 15,000. With the loan, she intends to pay school fees for her child.  With the previous loan, she expanded her tailoring business and increased her profits by 50 percent. She dreams of expanding and purchasing more sewing machines.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras  se formó con la unión de 13 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano, donde todas trabajan en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan ayudarse y salir adelante.
La Señora Mabel es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a confeccionar ropas de todo tipo, también uniformes a pedido, vestidos, etc. Es una señora muy creativa y con ganas de salir adelante.  Ella  tiene 2 hijos y su marido es Electricista.
Mabel solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo, como ser telas, hilos, agujas, botones y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) Committee came about with the gathering of 13 neighbors in the City of Mariano where they all worked so that, in this way, they could help themselves get ahead. 

Mabel is one of the committee's members. She makes clothing of all types, including uniforms on request, dresses, etc. Mabel is a creative woman with the desire to advance. She has 2 children and her husband is an electrician.

Mabel is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to continue with her work, including cloth, thread, needles, buttons, and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity offered, because it will be a great help.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señorita Laura tiene 19 años de edad es soltera y vive con su abuela  en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es estudiante, su abuela le paga sus estudio y como el estudio es muy caro decidió emprender un pequeño negocio y así poder ayudarla a con los gastos de su estudio. Fue así que decidió iniciar un negocio de venta de ropas. Hoy en día  ya tiene una buena clientela formada y necesita comprar más prendas para que de esa forma abastecerse y atraer a más clientes y así aumentar su ingreso. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ahora está ampliando su negocio de ventas y así mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas como ser pantalón, camisa, remera y otros. Agradece por la ayuda de Kiva y de Fundación paraguaya, pues ella quiere seguir creciendo y poder ser una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señorita Laura is 19 years old and single.  She lives with her grandmother in the city of Carapeguá. She is a student and her grandmother pays for her studies.  Since it is very expensive she decided to start a small business so she can help with her education expenses.  This is how she started her clothing sales business.  Now she has a good customer base and needs to buy more clothing so she can stock her business to attract more customers and increase her income.  Thanks to her hard work, she is now expanding her sales business and as a result, is able to maintain a good clientele.  

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as pants, shirts, t-shirts and other things.  She is grateful for the help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.  She wants to continue to grow and to be a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and brother). Sarah has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental houses.

The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van for easier transportation and also to build more houses for renting. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has  access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children and all her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members (her late brother's children). She owns a retail shop and sells on a retail basis. She works seven days a week .She has been in this   business for the last six years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income. 

Winnie has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt. Her major  business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to expand into the wholesale business and also buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 27-year-old married woman; her husband's name is Japhet Omari. Jennifer has three children between the ages of ten months and seven years, two of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water, and her highest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

Jennifer operates a business selling broiler chickens from her home, and her primary customers are restaurants. She's worked in this business for six months. Jennifer describes her greatest business challenge as the high cost of transportation. 

Jennifer will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and chicken food. Jennifer aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because existing members were successful.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken food.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a married woman. She has 2 children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a casual laborer. Rukia operates a cashew nuts selling business and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are the people who go to the market. Rukia's other source of income includes spouse contributions. She describes her greatest business challenges to be seasonality and inadequate capital to expand her business and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rukia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for resale. Rukia aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, y vieron en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad para poder progresar por medio del trabajo en equipo. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y con mucho entusiasmo en las actividades del grupo.
Elsi es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que tiene un copetín (puesto de comida y ventas varias) en el cual trabaja hace ya un tiempo, gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar con los gastos diarios de la casa y también enfrentar algún imprevisto. Cuenta que tiene buena clientela, ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho las comidas que ella prepara.
Elsi solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, pollo y demás insumos necesarios para los alimentos que hace. Agradece a por la oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of Coronel Oviedo got together with the objective of working together.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city.  They saw in Fundación Paraguaya’s program of the Committee for Enterprising Women a great opportunity to make progress by working as a team.  They are very hard-working people with a lot of enthusiasm for the groups’ activities.

Elsi is the president of the group.  She tells us that she has a “copetín” (a food stand and other various sales), in which she has worked for some time.  Thanks to this work she is able to help with the daily household expenses and also handle something unforeseen.  She says that she has a good clientele because her customers really like the food that she prepares.

Elsi is requesting the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, chicken, and the rest of the ingredients she needs for the food that she makes.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, chicken, and the rest of the ingredients she needs for the food that she makes.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora  se formó con la unión de 12 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en grupo que fortalezcan su compañerismo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y conocido en el barrio por esa unión.
La Señora Claudia es una de las integrantes del comité, es casada y tienen un hijo. Ella se dedica  a confeccionar manteles,  sabanas,  fundas, etc. Es una señora muy creativa y con ganas de salir adelante., es por ello que siempre se esfuerza para poder salir adelante.  Comenta que su trabajo lo hace para poder ayudar a su marido y de esa forma poder sobrellevar juntos el hogar y poder darle un estilo de vida digno a su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank was formed through the relationship of 12 neighbors in the city of Mariano.  All the members of the bank work independently, but they also have group activities that strengthen their companionship.  The members formed a very close group that is known all over the neighborhood for this relationship.

Claudia is one of the members of the bank.  She is married and they have one child.  She works making tablecloths, sheets, pillowcases, etc.  She is a very creative woman who very much wants to get ahead.  This is why she always makes the effort to be able to get ahead.  She comments that her job lets her be able to support her husband and in this way bear the household together and give a lifestyle of dignity to their child.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other supplies with which she will be able to continue working and filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 49 años de edad,  es viuda y cuenta que tiene 3 hijos.
Tiene un taller de costura bien equipado, es su local propio. Comenta que se inicio con un Copetín, y después cambio de ramo, en el cual hasta hoy le va muy bien, tiene clientela ya formada gracias al tiempo que lleva en su trabajo.
Estela nos cuenta que todo el trabajo que hace es por ayudar a sus hijos, pues ella quiere que sean personas de bien, que terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de tela en oferta, ya que es una buena oportunidad, pues tendrá una buena ganancia. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Señora Estela is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  She is 49 years old, a widow and has 3 children.  She has a well-equipped sewing shop in her own locale.  She says that she started out running a fast food counter and later changed to what she is doing today.  Things are going very well for her. She has an established clientele thanks to the time she has been in this line of work.  Estela tells us that all the work she does is to help her children as she wants them to be good people, finish their studies and be good professionals.  

She is requesting a loan to buy sale fabric as it is a good opportunity and she will earn more.  She is grateful to the organization for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: purchase fabric.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BALIMAYA  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  MEDINE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles font l'achat vente d'oignon,de pagnes, de produits alimentaires etc.
SANATA fait le commerce de pagnes dans ce groupe de femmes de  BALIMAYA,  elle se tient en troisième position à partir de la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et 5 pièces de pagnes reals au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Balimaya group are primarily married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous households in Médine, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they have requested in order to be able to meet customer demand.

The Balimaya group member Sanata, third from right in the picture, sells onions. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 10 pieces of wax pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) and 5 pieces of "pagne real" at Sikasso town's Grand Market. She and her family resell the pagnes from a fixed spot at the Sikasso Grand Market to a clientèle largely made up of women, for cash. She envisages making an average monthly profit of 27 500 francs, some of which will be used pay off her loan and the interest and some of which will be used to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne est un vieux retraité de 73 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis 2005. Il a déjà remboursé 6 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour financer le poulailler de son fils. Ce financement lui permettra de soutenir son enfant à mener une activité génératrice de revenus qui serviront a payer  régulièrement  les  factures  du foyer.  Ceci sera un grand soulagement pour l’emprunteur.
texts.en: Mr. Serigne is an aged retiree, 73 years old and living in Senegal. He  has been a member of a local branch of U-IMCEC since 2005. He already reimbursed six prior loans. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to finance  a chicken coop for his son. This financing will allow him to support his son in the business that  the son’s family relies on to pay their bills on time. This will be a big relief for Mr. Serigne.

loans.use: to finance his son's poultry business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 62 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as diapers, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.  She has been in this business for six years and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonora is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as canned goods, coffee, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, coffee, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Julie has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Julie is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of clothing to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en:
Flordiliza is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells vegetables & homemade snacks like rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years.

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy vegetables & raw ingredients for making snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordiliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. Mwanamisi operates a firewood selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanamisi will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase 2 carts of firewood for resale. Mwanamisi aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase 2 carts of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 59 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida.

Su historia comenzó hace 8 años la cliente comenzó con un fogón "para parrilladas" pequeño y con el transcurrir del tiempo y con la ayuda de d-miro se compra una carreta y vende hamburguesa y embutidos. En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace con su familia le ayuda con su negocio, no está casada, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 12, 6 años de edad.

Su sueño es poner otro carreta en otro lugar para tener más ventas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de comida  comprando carnes, panes, bebidas para hacer mas comidas rapida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 59, has many aspirations for her fast food sales business to prosper in the next few years.

Her story starts 8 years ago, when she had a small stove for grilling. With time and the help from D-Miro Bank, she was able to buy a cart and began selling hamburgers and sausages. Her family helps her with the business. She’s not married. She has 3 children, 10, 12 and 6 years old.

Her dream is to buy another cart and put it in another location to generate more sales. That’s why she wants the loan. She will invest it in her food business by buying meat, bread and drinks, that way she can make more fast food.

loans.use: buy meat, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is a 30-year-old married man. He has a son who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be social and respectful. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are women. He is also a Nissan driver (road racing) which increases his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of quality charcoal. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase charcoal for selling. Elly's business goal is to expand his charcoal selling business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with 2 children. He has a flower garden where he plants & sells flowers like daises. He has had this business for 6 years. 

He requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the flower garden. He has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Edilberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the flower garden

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  For more than 21 years, she has been raising and selling livestock. When they have fully grown, Xuraman offers them to butchers for sale. She raises them in a stall in the yard of her house. 

Xuraman is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which she will use to buy one cow for milk production. She believes that the cow will help increase her business. In the future she wants to increase her agriculture business and buy sheep for raising and selling.

loans.use: to purchase one cow for milk production.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  They reside in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs and poultry to sell for a profit to support the family. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Two of Mao's children are employed at the garment factory. Since the factory is far away for home, Mao is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children for commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her children until they get their bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide a better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Aissa Kane

texts.fr:
Madame   Aissa Kane est âgée de 37 ans, célibataire  et mère  de 1 enfant.  Elle vit chez ses parents   dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Sokala de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aissa Kane a abandonné l’école en classe de 9 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments, habits et chaussures. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle  décida d’évoluer seule  pour mener des activités de commerce général avec l’achat  vente de pommes de terre, d’habits, de chaussures, des fournitures scolaires à l’approche des rentrées des classes. Elle excelle dans ces activités depuis 12 ans et   jouit d’une grande notoriété et réputation. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 66 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 30 sacs de pommes de terres. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso et  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de nourrir sa mère et son fils  et de participer à des événements sociaux.  Son  ambition est de  construire  une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissa Kane is a 37-year-old single mother of one child. She lives with her parents in a large traditional family in the Ségou district of Sokala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Aissa Kane left school in the 9th grade of fundamental class (Malian educational system) to work alongside her mother selling condiments, clothing and shoes. After several years of training, she branched out to conduct her own business activity and started to buy and sell potatoes, clothing, shoes, and school supplies at the start of the school year. She is highly skilled, and has enjoyed great notoriety and reputation over the past 12 years. 

In order to bolster her working capital and increase her profits, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six and a half years ago. She received three group loans and four individual loans that were all correctly repaid. She is now seeking her 5th individual loan to buy 30 sacks of potatoes. She buys her stock in Sikasso and sells for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 CFAF, which will allow her to provide for her mother and her son, and to contribute to social events. Her goal is to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino, trabaja  todo el día como chofer propietario dentro de la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es el único ingreso para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el acabado de un muro en su casa, para dar más seguridad a su familia.
Marcelino es casado, vive con su esposa la cual vende verduras en un mercado y sus dos hijos en la casa de su suegra en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad del Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelino works all day as a driver with his own car in the city of La Paz.  This business activity is the only source of income to support his family.

He needs the loan for finishing a wall around his house in order to give his family more security.

Marcelino is married.  He lives with his wife, who sells vegetables at a market, and his two children in his mother-in-law’s house in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto.

This is the first time that he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to finish a wall around the perimeter of his house in order to provide greater security.

loans.name: Flor De Retama De Rumira Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Flor de Retama de Rumira” es un banco comunal  nuevo que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por  8 mujeres y 2 varones. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todas las socias tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad y viven en la comunidad de Rumira del distrito de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento  del Cusco.

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores, venta de maíz  y  venta de artesanía. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de vigilancia y costura.

(En la fotografía la socia Kenia está levantando la mano). 

La socia Kenia tiene 22 años y nació en la provincia de Ollantaytambo y vive en la comunidad de Rumira, ella vive junto con su pareja y tienen un único hijo de un año y dos meses. 

Su actividad económica principal de Kenia es tapizar muebles como por ejemplo sillas, sofás y otras más, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora sus productos.  En esta oportunidad Kenia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, tela, esponja, cola de carpintero y clavos.  Su sueño de Kenia es ampliar su negocio de tapicería en la ciudad del Cusco. 

(El socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso en día de la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Flor de Retama de Rumira” communal bank is a new one, pertaining to the “Asociacion Arariwa”. It is composed of 8 women and 2 men. The bank meets every 30 days and all the members have to be present at scheduled meetings. The majority of members are neighbors and friends who live in the community of Rumira, Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

The members are workers and entrepreneurs who seek opportunities at every moment to get ahead and through their daily efforts, to provide a better future for their children. The economic activities some of the members are involved in include, for example; selling vegetables, fruit, or groceries, raising small animals, selling corn, or selling their artisan crafts. Other members make dresses or work as security guards. 

In the photo, member Kenia may be seen raising her hand. She is 22 years old and was born in Ollantaytambo province, and resides in the community of Rumira. She lives with her husband and has just 1 son, aged 1 year and 2 months. Kenia's principal economic activity is upholstering furniture, including chairs, sofas, and other items. She has a small shop in her home where she makes her products. 

On this occasion, Kenia needs a loan to buy more work materials; for example, wood, cloth, sponge, wood glue, and nails. Kenia's dream is to expand her tapestry business in the city of Cusco.

(The member who appears in the lower part of the photo was excused on the day of the meeting.)

loans.use: buy work materials such as, for example, wood, cloth, sponge, wood glue and nails for upholstering furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy batteries, tools, etc.

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en: Rizalde is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. He has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Rizalde hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for over ten years and earns approximately USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately USD 4 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Sokha is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business, rebuild her present house, and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell. Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and the mother of two children aged six and two. She sells clothing materials, a business she ventured into seven years ago, and she earns a monthly income of about KES10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she will use to purchase clothing materials to sell. The profit she earns from this business would help repay her loan.This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells bananas & vegetables like squash & cabbages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables & bananas to sell. Irene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад проживает в районе Бохтар. Он женат. Ему 58 лет. У него трое детей. Его старший сын таксист. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Бохтар - Кургантюбе. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для покупки запчастей.
texts.en: Ahmad lives in the Bohtar region. He is 58 years old, married, and has three children. His oldest son is a taxi driver. Ahmad provides a service - he transports passengers on the Bohtar - Kurgantube route. He has been working in this field for two years. He is taking this loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Faustina;  la socia tiene 51 años de edad; ella es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia tambien vende artefactos, zapatos de forma independiente la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de mercaderia para poder vender a sus clientes y seguir trabajando. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia.


La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” (Always Together); this bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in both the Province and Department of Cusco.

The associate is Faustina. She is 51 years old, and has a partner and 3 children. She buys and sells clothing. She also sells artefacts and shoes, independently. The associate wants to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to sell to her clients and be able to continue working.

The associate is grateful for this opportunity to receive a loan that will permit her to invest in her business and grow economically.

loans.use: buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma;  la socia tiene 49 años de edad; ella es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de hambuerguesas, sandwich, jugos, la socia tiene un kiosko en un colegio en el cual ella vende todo lo referente a productos de snack, gaseosas, dulces, galletas entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates e insumos para la elaboracion de los diversos sandwiches. 



La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the Communal Bank “SIEMPRE JUNTOS” (Always Together); this bank is located in the District of Huanchac, in both the Province and Department of Cusco.

The associate is Vilma. She is 49 years old, and has a partner and 3 children. She makes hamburgers, sandwiches and juice. She has a kiosk at a school where she sells snacks, sodas, sweets and cookies, among others. The associate is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of items like cookies, soda, chocolates and ingredients for a variety of sandwiches. 

The associate is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan that will permit her to invest in her business and grow economically.

loans.use: buy cookies, soda, chocolates and ingredients for a variety of sandwiches.

loans.name: Edilma Nicolasa

texts.es:
Edilma es una mujer que tiene 44 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar su venta de ropa y articulos para cocina.

Su historia empezó desde que me separe de mi esposo sus mis hijos se quedaron pequeños. Tenía que salir a trabajar y empecé vendiendo artículos de hogar a crédito y comida rápida, su trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de los hijos, no tiene dificultades, esta separada de su marido, tiene 10 hijos

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio de venta de ropa y articulos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, articulos de cocina y otra parte de prestamo quiere comprar bloques, cemento para construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Edilma is a 44 year old woman who has many aspirations for helping her business to prosper over the next few years.  Her business is selling clothing and kitchen products.

Edilma's story begins when she separated form her husband and her children were young.  She had to go out to work and she started selling household goods on credit and fast food.  She carries out her work with the help of her children and doesn't have any problems.  She is separated from her husband and has 10 children.

Edilma's dream is to increase her business selling clothes and kitchen goods.  She would like this loan to buy clothes and kitchen goods.  She will also use part of the loan to buy blocks and cement so that she can build her home better.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products and clothing

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 15 per day. Additionally, she raises ducks to sell to generate more income to support the family. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns approximately USD 10 per day. All of her children are employed, two at the garment factory and another one is a construction worker. 

In order to develop her family economy, Oun is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to run a coffee shop to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to run a coffee shop to generate more income to support the family.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Nyagaza, who is in his mid 40's, is married with four children who go to school. He has been running a livestock business for 20 years now. He works from 2:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more goats and sheep, and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to still buy more goats and sheep to sell. His dream is to open a butcher shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Wito", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to add more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 55 years old, married and blessed with six children. He offers transport to the residents of Tala. He has been in this business for the last 6 years and gets an income of 11,000 KES per month.

Thomas has a good credit history in KADET LTD. He is applying for his fifth loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to add to his savings  and purchase a taxi.

He will use the extra profit to refinance back to the business. He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the future.

loans.use: to add to his savings to buy a taxi

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kameme is a 45 year old married woman. She has 2 children, 8 and 19 years old. Kameme describes herself to be social, honest and determined. She operates a general store where she sells charcoal, paraffin and kerosene. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Kameme's business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 36, is widowed and lives with her father and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working at a garment factory for over four years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. In order to generate more income and improve her family's living conditions, Sina is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy cattle to resell for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to buy more sows to breed so that she can produce more piglets to sell. She also plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger so that she can provide comfortable living conditions for her family and help her child to do well at school.

loans.use: to generate a larger income by buying cattle to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Daniel Muthama

texts.en: Daniel, a 42-year-old married father blessed with three children aged 16, 12 and 10 years, has owned a spare parts shop that earns him KES 150,000 per month for the past 15 years. Now requesting his fifth loan for KES 100,000 to help him purchase more spare parts as additional stock, he will reinvest the resulting extra profit into his business. Daniel's dream is to import more spare parts in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts as additional stock.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée de 40 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Secoura de la ville de Ségou. N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très tôt il embrassa le commerce de céréale auprès de sa maman qui vendait à la foire hebdomadaire de Konodimini. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage au côté de sa maman, elle évolua seule pour faire la même activité. Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité. elle vend sa marchandise au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femme. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 66 mois, après 5 prêts solidaire et 3 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés.
